hackathon-description-text: A hackathon taking it back to the old school, so hackathons used to be about getting together and having the space to create something new/brilliant stuff of your own choosing. In the spirit of that thought this hackathon is about daring to build that impossible something that is unique, may not not work or a totally niche hack that makes you tick. No matter if your hack works, we want you to use this day to work on your own or as an individual to bring these totally out of left field ideas to the surface.

hackathon-judges.judge-name: Ralph Stenzel, CTO and Co-Founder Dreamstake
Steve Karmeinsky,  CoFounder City Meets Tech and Lean Capital Ltd
Louis Sayers, Growth Hacker and Founding member at Driftrock
Ami Shpiro, Serial Entrepreneur and Director Innovation Warehouse

hackathon-requirements: You need to create a hack on 23rd Nov and present it at the end of the day to be judged at the venue the hackathon is taking place. All hacks must take place at Innovation Warehouse.
hackathon-rules:
Entry
Enter as an individual or team. 
Fresh Code! 
All code needs to be fresh! Prior to the hackathon you can create your design, 
wireframes, logo, and user flows.
It’s my code! 
All code created on the day is the IP of the team or the individual.
Submissions
All submissions should be uploaded onto challenge post. Submissions will be judged and prizes will be awarded on the day. 
Build Something Radical!
Build an inspired prototype to  solve any problem!

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion:
Technical Wow!
Application Design/UX
A good explaination of the hack & it's application

hackathon-description-header: A hackathon taking it back to the old school & allowing you to hack awesome stuff of your own accord!
